message.content:
cs.DB, cs.AR, cs.DC, cs.SE, cs.PL 

The paper discusses the challenges and approaches to building a polystore system that can handle heterogeneous workloads, which involves database queries, graph processing, and machine learning. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.DB (Databases), followed by cs.AR (Hardware Architecture), as the paper proposes using hardware accelerators to improve performance. The paper also discusses optimizing and mapping query plans across heterogeneous computing units, which falls under the category of cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing). Additionally, the paper mentions the need for programming environments to capture all aspects of the constituent workloads, which relates to cs.SE (Software Engineering). Finally, the paper proposes using specialized hardware to improve performance, which falls under the category of cs.PL (Programming Languages).
